trial_identification.studytitle: A randomized, placebo-controlled study of the safety and tolerability of PTG-100 in healthy volunteers
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study of single and multiple ascending doses of PTG-100 in normal healthy volunteers.

interventions.interventions: Oral administration Starting dose 100mg, then 300mg and 1000mg. Single (=1 day) and multiple (=14 days) for each dose of PTG-100 Each dose tested in a new cohort
interventions.comparator: placebo consists of buffer/excipient without any active drug

primaryOutcome.outcome: Safety and tolerability will be assessed using vital signs, clinical safety labs, ECGs, physical exams and adverse events.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: daily in-patient monitoring for 2 days following first dose in single dose part of the study and daily plus two days after last dose in multiple dose part. Subjects return for end of study visit 7 days after last dose.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: PK sample parameters include Cmax, Tmax and AUC calculated from blood plasma samples.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: PK samples will be collected at the following time points: 0, 15 mins, 30 mins, and hours 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 36, and 48 after the dose in the single dose part and also at the same time points in the multiple dose part on days 1, 11 and 14.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Normal healthy volunteers 18-55 years Good general health BMI 18-30kg/m2 Lab values within normal range Ability and willingness to attend visits to the site
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: History of significant abnormalities or diseases Clinical significant lab or ECG abnormalities Mentally or legally incapacitated History of substance abuse Inability to comply with the requirements of the study protocol

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: 306 Carmody Road St Lucia Brisbane 4067 QLD

fundingsource.fundingaddress: 306 Carmody Road St Lucia Brisbane 4067 QLD

ethicsAndSummary.summary:
The study is to assess the safety and tolerability of PTG-100 to normal healthy volunteers. This includes vital signs, safety labs and physical examinations
The drug will be given in single ascending then multiple ascending doses.
The study will also evaluate the PK of the drug after dose administration. Participants will be entered into standard study cohorts

ethicscommitee.ethicname: The Alfred Office of Ethics and Research Governance
